article_title: Health-related events, classes, more around Asheville
article_text:
Health events

KIDNEY SMART: May 3, 2-3:30 p.m., DaVita Dialysis Center, 10 McDowell St., Asheville. Free class focuses on causes of chronic kidney disease and how kidneys function. It also provides information on what treatment choices are available, how medications, diet and exercise work together, and assistance with insurance questions. Every first Tuesday. To register, call 828-255-2839 and ask for Sandra or Dana or visit www.davita.com.

MINDFUL EATING SKILLS BUILDING GROUP: Six-week series began at 5:30 p.m. April 19 at Nutritious Throughts, 819 Haywood Road, Asheville. $60 per group. Provides forum for growth and healing by introducing and simplifying the concept of mindful eating in a way that will eventually become natural to incorporate into your daily lives. To May 24. 828-333-0096 or www.nutritious-thoughts.com.

BUNCOMBE BLOOD DRIVES:

May 5, 1-5:30 p.m., Francis Asbury United Methodist Church, 725 Asbury Road, Candler

May 7, 11 a.m.-3 p.m., Asheville Outlets, 800 Brevard Road

May 9, 2 p.m.-6:30 p.m., West Asheville Baptist Church, 926 Haywood Road

May 15, 12:30 p.m.-4:30 p.m., Weaverville United Methodist Church, 85 N. Main St.

ADVANCED TAI CHI FOR HEALTH: 11 a.m.-noon Mondays to June 20, Warren Wilson Presbyterian Church, 701 Warren Wilson Road, Swannanoa. Completion of Tai Chi Level 1 and 2 are prerequisites for this class. Includes Qigong, self massage, mindfulness meditation and TCA Level 1 and 2. $140 for 10 weeks discounted to $126 with MD or PT referral. Contact Anne Plyler at 828-712-1150 or visit www.wnctaichiarthritis.com.

TAI CHI FOR ARTHRITIS LEVEL 1: 10-11 a.m. Mondays to June 20, Warren Wilson Presbyterian Church, 701 Warren Wilson Road, Swannanoa. Series of movements performed in a slow, focused manner. Low impact exercise that puts minimal stress on muscles and joints. $140 for 10 weeks, discounted to $126 with MD or PT referral. Payable at first class. Contact Anne Plyler at 828-712-1150 or visit www.wnctaichiarthritis.com.

AGELESS GRACE: Timeless Fitness for Body & Mind: 1:30-2:25 p.m. Tuesdays at Training Partners, 863 Merrimon Ave., Asheville. Improve quality of daily movement. Playful program simultaneously activates cognitive and physical function. Seated class addresses balance, breath, coordination, joint mobility, spinal flexibility, cardio and more. Eight-week pre-paid class cards at $80 can be used over 10 weeks or $12 per drop-in class. To register, contact Carol Gerson at agelessgracecarol@gmail.com or 828-606-9931.

FREE Heal, Revive and Thrive Workshop: 6-7:15 p.m. Tuesdays, Merrimon Family Chiropractic, 338 Merrimon Ave., Asheville. Through the latest medical and holistic research, learn how a healthy nervous system eliminates or reduces chronic pain, illnesses, disease and maximizes mental and physical performance. Stay and have a free exam, X-ray and doctor analysis. 828-255-8333 or serenityallen1977@gmail.com.

ESSENTIAL OILS CLASS: 5:30-7 p.m. Wednesdays to Oct. 26, Nectar Cafe, 853 Merrimon Ave., Asheville. A free educational class about using and incorporating essential oils into your daily life and routines. Free samples. RSVP to 828-338-9962 or Naturegirl2120@yahoo.com.

QIGONG for Health & Heart: 10 a.m. Wednesdays, Unity Center, 2041 Old Fanning Bridge Road, Mills River. Slow, meditative movements to improve balance, restore health and connect you with your heart energy. Can be done standing or sitting. $5 suggested donation. 201-452-8244 or www.starhorsejourneys.com.

HEALTH INSURANCE ASSISTANCE: Pisgah Legal Services, 62 Charlotte St., Asheville. PLS offers free year-round appointments with Health Care Navigators so you can explore your options for getting affordable health insurance. Call 828-210-3437 to make an appointment.

HEALTH INSURANCE ASSISTANCE: The Council on Aging of Buncombe County, 46 Sheffield Circle, Asheville. Free year-round appointments with certified SHIIP Medicare counselors and Affordable Care Act Navigators who give unbiased counseling. Call 828-277-8288 for a Medicare appointment and 855-733-3711 to schedule appointment with a trained ACA Navigator.

LOW BACK PAIN AND SCIATICA WORKSHOP: May 17, 6:30-7:30 p.m., (every third Tuesday), Physio Physical Therapy and Wellness, 640 Merrimon Ave., Suite 107, Asheville. Reveals how to naturally heal back pain and sciatica. Learn the single biggest mistake sufferers make which actually stops healing, three most common causes of lower back pain, and more. Free. 828-333-5003 or www.physiownc.com/lower-back-pain-and-sciatica-workshop/.

FOOD FOR LIFE: Diabetes Initiative program: Four-week class begins at 5:30 p.m. May 17, Asheville Gynecology & Wellness, 11 Crispin Court, Suite, E-106, Asheville. The goal is to empower people who have diabetes and those concerned about developing diabetes, along with their friends and family members, with new information and skills. Each class offers a cooking demonstration of health-promoting dishes, along with take-home packet of easy and affordable recipes. Three new recipes each class. $100. Registration required. 828-863-4231 or https://www.eventbrite.com.

FAIRVIEW CHIROPRACTIC OPEN HOUSE: May 17, 5-7 p.m., Fairview Chiropractic Center, 2 Fairview Hills Drive., Fairview. Dr. Reilly invites the public to learn how he can help with hard-to-treat conditions such as neuropathy, fibromyalgia, post-concussion syndrome, and many more. Light refreshments served, free health screenings available, door prizes given. Free. 828-628-7800 or http://fairviewdc.com.

FOOD FOR LIFE: Diabetes Initiative program: Four-week class begins at 6 p.m. May 19, Steps to HOPE, 60 Ward St., Columbus. $100. Registration required. 828-863-4231 or https://www.eventbrite.com.

HOSPICE Informational Session and Volunteer Orientation: May 19, 5-8:30 p.m., Skyland United Methodist Church, 1984 Hendersonville Road, Asheville. Learn about hospice and palliative care services in Buncombe, Henderson and Haywood Counties. This will also serve as orientation for new hospice volunteers who will have the option of continuing in Patient and Family Support training on May 21. Free but call Mike at 828-233-0948 to register. Visit www.fourseasonsCFL.org.

A MATTER OF BALANCE Volunteer Coach Training: May 20, 8:30 a.m.-4:30 p.m., Land-Of-Sky Regional Council, 339 New Leicester Highway, Asheville. A Matter of Balance reduces the fear of falling to encourage an active lifestyle. Programs serve community-dwelling older adults in Buncombe, Madison, Henderson and Transylvania Counties. Volunteers must commit to leading two, eight-session series within a year of being trained. Free. Contact Stephanie Stewart at 828-251-7438 or visit www.landofsky.org/fallprevention.html to register.

Health screenings

BLOOD PROFILE TESTING: 8:30-10 a.m. Wednesdays, Opportunity House, 1411 Asheville Highway, Hendersonville. No appointment needed. Comprehensive metabolic, complete blood count, lipid panel, thyroid, PSA and urinalysis to name a few. For a complete list of tests and pricing, visit www.opportunityhouse.org and click on newsletter. Results are usually back in a few days. Cash, checks and credit cards accepted. 828-692-0575.

Meditation

ASHEVILLE MOVEMENT COLLECTIVE DANCES: 7 p.m. Fridays at Asheville Academy of Ballet, 4 Weaverville Road, and 8:30 and 10:30 a.m. Sundays at the Masonic Temple, 80 Broadway St., downtown. Non-instructional, free-form dances to inspire authenticity and healthy community. No prior experience required. $7-$15. http://ashevillemovementcollective.org.

Support groups

NAMI: National Alliance on Mental Illness-Family to Family Class: Tuesdays 6:30-9 p.m. to May 24, NAMI Western Carolina, 356 Biltmore Ave., Asheville. Free Family-to-Family education program for family, caregivers, and friends of individuals living with a mental illness. Email pamelajaillet@gmail.com or call 828-989-2365. Visit www.namiwnc.org.

YWCA Diabetes Wellness and Prevention Program: YWCA of Asheville, 185 S. French Broad Ave. Do you have Type 2 Diabetes or are you at risk for having it? Then you qualify to join this program. Sliding scale rate, starting at $15 per month. Access to fitness center and classes, pool and pool classes, personal trainer, weekly support group meetings and more. Call 828-254-7206, ext. 212 to register.

MINDFUL MEALTIME SUPPORT GROUP: Meets at noon on Tuesdays, Nutritious Thoughts, 819 Haywood Road, Asheville. We invite all clients struggling with an eating disorder or disordered eating patterns to join weekly dietitian-led group. Designed to assist participants in finding a balanced relationship with food. $35 per group. Accepted by Blue Cross/BlueShield. 828-333-0096 or www.nutritious-thoughts.com.

EATING DISORDERS ANONYMOUS: 5:30 p.m. Tuesdays, 542 N. Oak St., Hendersonville. The meeting is offered for those in recovery from all eating disorders including anorexia, bulimia, and binge eating disorder. Visit www.4EDA.org .

GRIEF CLASSES: CarePartners, 68 Sweeten Creek Road, Asheville, offers grief classes at its bereavement center. 828-251-0126.

BETTER TOGETHER: Life Limiting Illness Support Group: 6:30 p.m. Tuesdays, Secrets of A Duchess, 1439 Merrimon Ave., Asheville. For adults managing the challenges of cancer, diabetes, heart disease, autoimmune diseases. Free but call 386-801-2606 to reserve your spot. Visit www.WildPrecious.Life.

RESOLVE PEER-LED INFERTILITY SUPPORT: 6:30 p.m. every first Thursday, Earth Fare South, 1856 Hendersonville Road, Asheville. http://www.resolve.org.

NUTRITION: 5:30 p.m. Thursdays, Nutritious Thoughts, 819 Haywood Road, Asheville. Support a balanced relationship with food, movement and body. Designed to build a strong community around positive recovery from an eating disorder, disordered eating, or weight-related concerns. $35/hour group. Accepted by Blue Cross/BlueShield. 828-333-0096 or www.nutritious-thoughts.com.

GAMBLING: 12 Step Gamblers Anonymous Meeting: 6:45-7:45 p.m. Thursdays, lower level conference room at Basilica of Saint Lawrence, 97 Haywood St., Asheville. A closed meeting reserved for people that have or think they may have a gambling problem. Anonymity is first and foremost. We welcome you with open arms. Park behind church and ring bell at back door. Contact Casey at 828-318-4800 or kc1st@mac.com. Visit www.gamblersanonymous.org.

REFUGE RECOVERY: 7-8:30 p.m. Fridays and 6-7:30 p.m. Sundays, Urban Dharma, 29 Page Ave., Asheville. Open to anyone interested in a Buddhist path to recovery, whether they identify themselves as addicts, alcoholics, substance abusers, codependents or addictive personalities of any variety. Drawn from the book “Refuge Recovery” by Noah Levine. Free. Contact Daniel Fishburn at 828-367-7377 or refugerecoveryavl@gmail.com or visit https://www.facebook.com/refugerecoveryavl.

FOOD ADDICTION: 5:30 p.m. Mondays, Grace Episcopal Church in the Mountains, 394 N. Haywood St., Waynesville.

BEREAVEMENT-Marshall: Every third Tuesday 2-3 p.m., Center Community Center, 1300 Grapevine Road, Marshall. www.hotspringshealth-nc.org.

DIABETES: Every third Wednesday 3:30-5 p.m., Mission Health Diabetes and Health Education Center, 1 Hospital Drive, third level, room 3308, Asheville. Contact Laura Tolle at 828-213-4788 or Laura.Tolle@msj.org.

IN GOOD COMPANY Breast Cancer Support: Every third Thursday 5:30-6:30 p.m., SECU Cancer Center, 21 Hospital Drive, room R-120, Asheville. For breast cancer survivors. Husbands, children and friends encouraged to participate. For more information, call Denise Steuber at 828-213-2508 or Janet Magruder at 828-213-2507.

BRAIN INJURY SUPPORT FOR TEENS & YOUNG ADULTS: Every fourth Tuesday, 6-8 p.m., Foster Seventh-Day Adventist Church, 375 Hendersonville Road, Asheville. Contact Karen Harrington at 828-277-4868.

BEREAVEMENT-Mars Hill: Every fourth Thursday, 2-3 p.m., Mars Hill Retirement Center, 170 S. Main St., Mars Hill. www.hotspringshealth-nc.org.

BEREAVEMENT-Hot Springs: Every first Tuesday, 3-4 p.m., Hot Springs Library, 356 N.W. U.S. 25/70, Hot Springs. For anyone in the Madison County area who has lost a loved one. www.hotspringshealth-nc.org.

ESSENTIAL TREMORS: Every first Thursday, 6 p.m.,CarePartners, 68 Sweeten Creek Road, Asheville. Contact Rita Lyda at 828-298-4085.

BURN SURVIVORS: Every first Saturday, 2-4 p.m., CarePartners, 68 Sweeten Creek Road, Asheville. Meets in Seymour Auditorium. Contact Frank Hensley at frank@greenstreet.org.

BEREAVEMENT-Marshall: Every first Sunday, 6-7 p.m., Asheville-Buncombe Technical Community College, 4646 U.S. 25-70, Marshall. www.hotspringshealth-nc.org.

SPINAL CORD INJURY: Every first Sunday, 11 a.m.-noon, CarePartners, 68 Sweeten Creek Road, Asheville. Support group for caregivers and patients. Contact Pam Griffin at 828-274-9567, ext. 6240.

DEPRESSION: Every first Monday, 6-7:30 p.m., Pardee Signature Care Center at Blue Ridge Mall, Four Seasons Boulevard, Hendersonville. A time for those suffering to share personal stories, express emotions, and be heard in an atmosphere of acceptance, understanding, and encouragement. Learn about medications, how to manage symptoms, develop better coping skills, how to communicate better with physician, and how to identify triggers that bring on symptoms. 828-692-4600.

CARING FOR THE SOUL-Mental Illness: Every first Monday, brick house behind church at Black Mountain United Methodist Church, 101 Church St., Black Mountain. Support group for people with mental illness diagnosis and/or family members and loved ones. Contact Paulette Heck at 828-581-0080 or pheck812@gmail.com or visit www.namiwnc.org.

LUPUS: 7-8 p.m. every second Wednesday, Cathedral of All Souls, 9 Swan St., Asheville. Lupus Foundation of America-N.C. Chapter for those living with lupus, their family and caregivers. There is no charge to attend and drop-ins are welcome. Email info@lupusnc.org or call 877-849-8271, ext. 1. Also visit www.lupusnc.org.

INCONTINENCE: Every second Thursday, 1 p.m., West Asheville. For those suffering from or affected by any level or form of incontinence. For more information e-mail WNCIncontSG@bellsouth.net.

ASHEVILLE ADULT ADHD Meetup Group: Every third Monday, 7-8:30 p.m., in Asheville. Meet other local adults dealing with ADD or ADHD. Discuss the latest topics and share your experiences and strategies to deal with ADHD. Free but call 828-301-1904 to register or visit http://www.meetup.com/Asheville-Adult-ADHD-Meetup-Group/.

ADDICTION COUNSELING: Narconon can help you take steps to overcome addiction in your family. Call 800-431-1754 for free screenings or referrals.
